title: Schwarzböck 2016 Vier Gärten Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: The fresh, peardrop-scented nose of this bottling is appetizing. Similarly clean flavors brighten its dry and easy-drinking palate: green pear, lemon flesh and zest. A friendly, light summer wine.

title: Season 2014 Marsanne-Roussanne (Southern Oregon)
description: This tasty white wine has skin flavors in abundance–citrus peel and apple, with a bit of white peach as well. It's sleek and focused, not afraid to show a touch of bitterness to frame the fruit. It might benefit from decanting an hour or so before consuming it.

title: Shaw 2009 Keuka Hill Reserve Red (Finger Lakes)
description: Dark toast, dill and tobacco frame this late-release Bordeaux-style blend, but there's still plenty of pristine black cherry and cassis flavor too. It's surprisingly fresh and fruity, balanced crisply in acidity and alcohol. The finish lingers on a sweet-tart berry tone.

title: Vega Sicilia 2008 Unico  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Name and reputation get you only so far, as this underwhelming offering from a poor vintage proves. Compact stewy aromas of baked berry fruits and asphalt are the appetizer. A main course of chunky jammy stewy berry and prune flavors finishes with a desiccated essence. Unico is known to age for decades, but not this vintage. Drink now for what it's worth.

title: Vignobles de Saint-Tropez 2016 Château la Moutte Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The vines of Saint-Tropez are often within sight of the sea in the hills above the famous resort. This single-estate wine from a property managed by the Saint-Tropez cooperative contrasts fresh fruit and acidity with a generous ripe texture. It is soft, fruity and ready to drink now.

title: Vilarnau 2013 Brut Nature Vintage Sparkling (Cava)
description: Apple, peach and yeast aromas are welcoming but a little wayward. This brut nature shows roundness on the palate and no coarseness. Briny apple and dried-apricot flavors are calm on the finish.

title: Vilarnau NV Reserva Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
description: Floral melon and peach aromas are mellow. This feels round, with citrusy acidity cutting into the body. Basic grapefruit and apricot flavors are friendly, while this is a touch foamy on the finish.

title: Terrazas de Los Andes 2014 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Blackberry, oak, spice and chocolate aromas are dealt in equal parts. This feels ripe and fairly plush. Flavors of burnt toast, black pepper and charred wood lead secondary fruit notes across the palate and onto the finish.

title: The Federalist 2015 Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Toasted oak and maple syrup aromas meet indulgent brown sugar and blackberry jam flavors in this very ripe-tasting, full-bodied wine. It's easy to gulp and enjoy, not being especially brawny or tannic, and should be great with pulled pork or Mexican molé.

title: Tinhof 2016 Blanc White (Burgenland)
description: This feisty, fragrant blend unites the citrus zestiness of Riesling and the herbal savor of Grüner Veltliner. The palate is light and bright but gently spiced, with Grüner's toothsome texture. Fresh, easy-drinking and ideal for summer.

title: Tinhof 2016 Neuburger (Burgenland)
description: This wine's nose gives little more than a suggestion of zesty ripeness. The palate, on the other hand, is full of friendly, lively fruit. Crisp green and yellow apple and ripe citrus pervade its slender but joyful frame. Zesty and fresh, it only faintly hints of the variety's usual nuttiness.

title: Koehler 2013 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Light in color, this bottling from winemaker Colin Murphy shows rounded red plum and tart strawberry scents, with graphite and wet river stone minerality. The palate is lively with acid-driven red fruit that's round and full on the midpalate.

title: Dürnberg 2016 Falko Cool Climate Falkenstein White (Niederösterreich)
description: An intriguing touch of bergamot permeates the nose. The palate is fruity, aromatic and lithe. This is a summer wine par excellence: fresh, easy-drinking and light bodied. Drink now, while the aromas are at their peak.

title: Epiphany 2014 Rodney's Vineyard Petite Sirah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Charred black plum, cola and licorice aromas show in this rare bottling of Petite Sirah from Santa Barbara County. The palate is streaked with dark purple and black fruit, its tarry tannins and sharp acidity dissolving rather quickly.

title: Fidelitas 2014 Fidelitas Estate Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
description: Herb, anise, baking-spice, smoke and dark-fruit aromas are followed by medium-bodied fruit flavors surrounded by velvety tannins. The balance is just about spot on.

title: Fabre en Provence 2016 Château de l'Aumérade Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: From a Provence estate bearing the name of the family that has owned it for 17 generations, this wine is crisp, fruity and bright. It has a light touch of acidity, as well as red currant and spice flavors. The wine, with its lively aftertaste, is in a fine apéritif style.

title: Familie Zull 2016 Lust & Laune Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: Green and yellow pear notes make an immediate appearance on the nose of this wine Its zippy, easy-drinking palate is enlivened with spritz and brings that characteristic savory, yeasty herb flavor to bear. Fresh, easy, dry and light, it finishes zesty and clean.

title: Eight Bells 2016 Boushey Vineyard Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)
description: Very alluring yellow apple and Bosc pear aromas are followed by an elegantly styled palate, with racy lemony acids on the finish. It shows a pleasing sense of purity and elegance. Pair it with food to see it at its best.

title: Weixelbaum 2016 Stephanus Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: The fruitiness of fresh, green Conference pears fills the nose of this wine. Its palate is more subdued, with streamlined, citrus freshness, compact body and a dry, refreshing finish.

title: Cottonwood Canyon 2013 Patience Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Longtime winemaker Norman Beko has packed this intriguing cool-climate Syrah with thyme, lavender, pepper, elderberry and Mission fig aromas. The palate is sagebrush-driven, with red fruit, white pepper and more lavender flavors.

title: Curto 2012 Krio Syrah (Terre Siciliane)
description: Made entirely from Syrah, this offers earthy black-skinned fruit, tilled soil and leather aromas. The round, friendly palate delivers blackberry jam, black plum and white pepper flavors, alongside smooth tannins.

title: Domaine de Beaupré 2016 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: This attractive fruity wine is just the ticket for summer food. It has weight and plenty of ripe red-berry fruits. It also has a crisper than usual edge that gives it a bright character. There are a touch of pepper and a final lift of acidity. Drink now.

title: Attic Cellar 2014 R Is For Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: This elegant nectarine-scented Riesling is a notable solo project by Hazlitt winemaker Michael Reidy. It's deft on the palate, but offers plenty of ripe quince and tangerine flavors accentuated by zesty lime acidity. It finishes moderately long.

title: Bellangelo 2014 1866 Reserve Chardonnay (Seneca Lake)
description: Immaculate freshness abounds in this zesty Chardonnay. While supple and quite creamy on the palate, pristine lemon and pear flavors and a vibrant backdrop of lemony acidity invigorate. Elegantly meshed vanilla and spice tones linger on the finish.

title: Berryessa Gap 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Yolo County)
description: A chalky, mineral aroma leads to lively green apple and dried herb flavors. This wine is light-bodied and subdued but has enjoyable, savory flavors to complement its moderate fruitiness and an easy elegance that separates it from the pack.

title: Calera 2015 Fortieth Anniversary Vintage Viognier (Mt. Harlan)
description: A difficult vintage across the state, 2015 was especially tough in remote and dry places like Mt. Harlan. Despite that hurdle, Josh Jensen pulled off a delicate winner with this bottling, which shows white peach, honeydew and Meyer lemon scents on the nose. The flavors are also light, with nectarine and Asian pear most prominent, all enwrapped in nervy tension.

title: Capolino Perlingieri 2015 Preta Falanghina (Sannio)
description: This wine's delicate nose offers white spring flower, Mediterranean herb and wet stone aromas. They carry over to the fresh palate, joining fruity green apple and pineapple notes while a savory mineral tone warms the finish.

title: Cedar River Cellars 2014 Bella Bella Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: All coming from Burgess Vineyards, unusual aromas of gun smoke, purple fruit, herb, baking spice and ham hock lead to softly textured fruit and savory flavors. It brings plenty of intrigue but it's not for all tastes.

title: Château d'Astros 2016 La Plaine des Maures Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This wine is particularly fruity with red-currant and raspberry flavors right up front. Crisp and lively, it is bone dry and packed with acidity as well as the great fruitiness. Ready to drink now. The 12th-century estate has been in the same family since the early 19th century.

title: Château Ferry Lacombe 2016 Haedus Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Named after a group of astronomical stars know as the Kids (as in goats), this wine is smooth and ripe. It has rich red fruits that have a juicy character and plenty of acidity. It is a fine refreshing wine that is ready to drink now.
